disparities_assessment.barriers: We are sharing survey information with a county-wide organization. We expect to have better answers by the end or the year so that we may address existing disparities

behavioral_health_assessment.admin_data_sources: Our police department has a DART team that tracks EMT responses and overdoses.
behavioral_health_assessment.barriers: We are in the process of gathering information on the mental health/co-occurring conditions. We are a small community with limited behavioral health resources. Services are spread throughout the western Mass area, making it challenging to pinpoint local data on 30-day use, and people in recovery/in treatment.

existing_programs.other_methods: Belchertown has a working group tasked with substance use, prevention, harm reduction, mental health, etc. Their meetings include representatives from organizations who are working in this arena. Because of our location/relatively small population, transportation is a known hindrance for accessing supportive programming.

practices.name: increasing capacity of town's Drug Free Communities staff to deliver education and resources about opioid misuse prevention
after-school support program for middle school students including health and wellness education on substance use and mental health as prevention tools

innovation_practices.other_methods: We consulted with school officials and gathered information about past successes with an after-school program for middle school students and how that helped with promoting healthy choices, wellness, and student confidence in their capabilities to avoid health risks.

planning.process: Our municipality conducted its own planning process.

criminal_justice.barriers: There is a countywide program that works more closely with this population and they attend our committee meetings to update us on their work and to share information. We partner with Hampshire HOPE to avoid duplication and ensure that we inform our community about services.

how_spent: Supported programs, policies, and practices that have demonstrated effectiveness in preventing drug misuse among youth
Supported community coalitions in developing and implementing a comprehensive strategic plan for substance misuse prevention
Supported community-based education or intervention services for families, youth, and adolescents at risk for OUD
Increased access to mental health services and support for young people provided either in the school or in the community that, if unaddressed, increases the risk of opioid or other drug use
Other (please specify):: supplies and refreshments for Listening Session on April 25, 2024

additional_comments.general: Our advisory committee continues to look at ways to support persons in need of treatment and recovery services; we are researching efforts underway and available to our residents. We are working to partner with local agencies and have developed a grant-making process so that local providers can apply for funds based on needs already identified.
additional_comments.unmet_needs: We continue to look at ways that other communities are providing direct financial assistance to persons in need, such as for first/last month's rent for housing, funeral costs, emergency food/utilities costs, etc., but have struggled to see how that might work in our town and what organizational structures and personnel would be needed for such a program to be implemented and managed. We are looking at examples of this type of program in Boston and elsewhere.
additional_comments.orrf_recommendations: In our rural area, we want to further look at ways to increase access to support services, such as social workers and resources navigators in our community; we need to more deeply think about how and where such services could be located in town government and/or local non-profit agencies so that funds are spent wisely without duplicating existing efforts. We have found that many persons in need are still unaware of services despite significant efforts to reach community members with information in all sorts of media and community settings.
